messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the llvm-project program, here is the asan report

This is an LLVM error report. Please refer the error message for more details.

clang-21: /tmp/llvm-gh-136432/build/clang/lib/AST/DeclCXX.cpp:1699: clang::NamedDecl* getLambdaCallOperatorHelper(const clang::CXXRecordDecl&): Assertion `!Calls.empty() && "Missing lambda call operator!"' failed.

0. 1693| static NamedDecl* getLambdaCallOperatorHelper(const CXXRecordDecl &RD) {
1694|   if (!RD.isLambda()) return nullptr;
1695|   DeclarationName Name =
1696|       RD.getASTContext().DeclarationNames.getCXXOperatorName(OO_Call);
1697|

1699|   assert(!Calls.empty() && "Missing lambda call operator!");
1700|   assert(allLookupResultsAreTheSame(Calls) &&
1701|          "More than one lambda call operator!");
1702| 
1703|   // FIXME: If we have multiple call operators, we might be in a situation
1704|   // where we merged this lambda with one from another module; in that
1705|   // case, return our method (instead of that of the other lambda).
1706|   //
1707|   // This avoids situations where, given two modules A and B, if we
1708|   // try to instantiate A's call operator in a function in B, anything
1709|   // in the call operator that relies on local decls in the surrounding
1710|   // function will crash because it tries to find A's decls, but we only
1711|   // instantiated B's:
1712|   //
1713|   //   template <typename>
1714|   //   void f() {
1715|   //     using T = int;      // We only instantiate B's version of this.
1716|   //     auto L = [](T) { }; // But A's call operator would want A's here.
1717|   //   }
1718|   //
